intro: Lepanthes pelyx, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, yellow-and-white flowers that resemble a star, with a prominent central lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are usually elongated and dark green, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. Lepanthes pelyx is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by orchid enthusiasts.
